gurmukhi: gHn sUrj ky idn kurKyqR Awvn kQnM ]
transliteration: Grahan Sooraj Ke Din Kurkhet Aavan Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description of coming to Kurukshetra on the day of Sun-Eclipse

gurmukhi: jau riv ky gRsby hU ko idvs ligE kih joiqkIXo qu sunwXO ] kwnH kI mwq ibmwq Aru BRwq cly kurKyqR iehY ThrwXo ]
transliteration: Jau Rav(i) Ke Grasbe Hoo Ko Divas Lagio Kah(i) Jotikeeyo Tu Sounaayau|| Kaahn Kimaat Bimaat Ar(u) Bhraat Chale Kurkhetra Ihai Thahraayo||
translation: When the astrologers told about the sun-eclipse, then the mother and brother of Krishna thought about going to Kurukshetra;

gurmukhi: qwq clXo biRjnwQ ko lY sMig BwNqn BwNq ko sYn bnwXo ] jo koaU AMq chY iqh ko iqn ko kCu Awvq AMq n pwXo ]2415]
transliteration: Taat Chadyo Brijnaath Ko Lai San Bhaantan Bhaant Ko Sain Banaayo|| Jo Ko( i)  Ant Chahai Tih Ko Tin Ko Kachh(u) Aavat Ant Na Paayo||2415||
translation: Forming different groups, the father of Krishna started going and this all was so mysterious and wonderful that none could understand it.2415.

gurmukhi: ieq qy biRj nwiek Awvq By auq nMd qy Awid sBY iqh Awey ] cMdRBgw biRKBwn suqw sB guAwrin sXwm jbY drswey ]
transliteration: It Te Brij Naaik Aavat Bhe Out Nand Te Aadh Sabhai Tih Aae|| Channdrabhagad Brikhbhaan Soutaa Sabh Guaaran(i) Syaam Jabai Darsaae||
translation: From this side, Krishna was coming and from that side Nand and all other people including Chander Bhaga, Radha and gopis were seen coming by Krishna;

gurmukhi: rUp inhwr rhI cik kY jik gI kCu bYn kihE nhI jwey ] nMd jsomq moh bFwie kY kwnH jU ky aur mY lptwey ]2416]
transliteration: Roop Nihaar Chak(i) Kai Jak(i) Gikachh(u) Bain Kahio Nahijaae|| Nand Jasomat Moh Badhaae Kai Kaahn Joo Ke Ur Mai Laptaae||2416||
translation: They all became wonder-struck and silent on seeing the beauty of Krishna; Nand and Yashoda, feeling extreme affection, hugged him.2416.

gurmukhi: nMd jsomq pRym bFwie kY nYnn qy doaU nIr bhwXo ] AYsy kihXo biRj kau qum iqAwg gey mQurw jIA AYsy hI BwXo ]
transliteration: Nand Jasomat Prem Badhaae Kai Nainan Te Dooo Neer Bahaayo|| Aise Kahiyo Brij Kau Toum Tiaag Gad Mathuraa Jeea Aise Hibhaayo||
translation: Nand-Yashoda, affectionately, with tears flowing from their eyes, said, “O Krishna! you had suddenly abandoned Braja and came here; it seems that Matura is more dear to you;

gurmukhi: kw BXo jo qum mwr cMBUr pHwr kysM gih kMsih GwXo ] hau inrmoh inhwr dSw hmrI qumry mn moh n AwXo ]2417]
transliteration: Kaa Bhayo Jo Toum Maar Channdoor Prahaar Kesan Gadh Kansah(i) Ghaayo|| Hau Nirmoh Nihaar Dashaa Hamritoumre Man Moh Na Aayo||2417||
translation: What then if you killed Chandur and knocked down and killed Kansa by catching him from his hair; O unkind one! did you not feel even a little of affection on seeing our condition?”2417.

gurmukhi: pRIq bFwie jsomq XO biRjBUKn sO iek bYn aucwro ] pwl kIey jb pUq bfy qum dyKXo qbY qum hyq quhwro ]
transliteration: Preet Badhaae Jasomat Yau Brijbhookhan Sau Ik Bain Oucdaro|| Paal Keee Jab Poot Bade Toum Dekhyo Tabai Toum Het Tudaro||
translation: Then Yashoda said affectionately to Krishna, “O son! I have brought you up, and you witnessed it your self that how much affection have you for me.

gurmukhi: qokh doS lgwau hau ikau hir hY sB hI Pun doS hmwro ] aUKl so quih bwND kY mwrXo hY jwnq hau soaU bYr icqwro ]2418]
transliteration: Tokah Dosh Lagado Hau Kio Har(i) Hai Sabh Hiphoun Dosh Hadaro|| Ookhal So Tuhe Baandh Kai Mdaryo Hai Jaanat Hau Sooo Bair Chidaro||2418||
translation: “But you are not at fault, all fault is mine; it appears that on tying you with the mortar, once I beat you, remembering that affliction, you are taking this revenge.2418.

gurmukhi: mwie hau bwq kho qum sO su qo mY bqIAw sun swc pqIjY ] Aaurn kI isK lY qb ijau qYso kwj kro ijn XO sun lIjY ]
transliteration: Maae Hau Baat Kaho Toum Sau Su To Mai Bateeaa Soun Sach Pateejai|| Auran Kisikh Lai Tab Jio Taiso Kaaj Daro Jin Yau Soun Leejai||
translation: “O mother ! whatever I am saying unto you, consider it as true and do not conclude anything on being told anything by someone else;

gurmukhi: nYk ibCoh Bey qumry mrIAY qumry pl hyrq jIjY ] bwl blwie ilau hau bhuro biRj kO biRj BUKn BUKn kIjY ]2419]
transliteration: Naik Bichhodh Bhae Toumredareeai Toumre Pal Heart Jeejai|| Baal Balaae Lio Hau Bahuro Brij Kau Brij Bhookhan Dhoodhat Keejai||2419||
translation: “I feel the condition of death on being separated from you; and I can keep alive only on seeing you; O mother ! during my childhood, you took all my sufferings on yourself, now give me the honour of making me the ornament of Braja again.”2419.
